alien.desc: They often hunt with the help of a Gastic's illusions. Their motivation for frightening humans is not fully understood.
alien.name: Albrax

recruit.description: 3+ times, TAG OUT a Beastie

alien1.desc: There are numerous reports of coaches seeing their Beasties swooped up by Yueffowl at night, only to find them returned unharmed in the morning.
alien1.name: Yueffowl

recruit.description: 2+ times, TAG OUT a Beastie

bat.desc: They nurture the children on their belly until they're strong enough to forage for themselves. Their pups maintain an exclusive diet of fresh fruit juice.
bat.name: Froofulks

recruit.description: Restore STAMINA 5+ times

bat1.desc: They use all their energy to fly and are constantly foraging for sources of sugar to replenish themselves. Their overall health has been in decline in recent years.
bat1.name: Jellibat

recruit.description: Restore STAMINA 2+ times

beluga.desc: They live at high elevations, absorbing moisture from clouds. They communicate with flashes of light from their antennae.
beluga.name: Deluja

recruit.description: Use any effect on a benched Beastie

bestie.desc: They lack any aggression at all. Using their tail as a lure, they invite other Beasties into their burrow to offer them food.

value.description: A Diggum must [sprBoost,1]BOOST [sprIcon,1]POW [sprBoost,0][sprBoost,0][sprBoost,0] or more and deal 100+ damage with an attack

bestie.name: Diggum

recruit.description: Fulfill recruit conditions for 2+ of this Beasties' allies

bestiemon.desc: Celia's Notes: They seem very capable of murder. Watch out for those tusks.
bestiemon.name: Duggout

recruit.description: Heal 2+ times

bilby.desc: A single Bandicraft will manage 20 acres of land. They construct homes and care for other Beasties in their territory.
bilby.name: Bandicraft

recruit.description: 4+ times, use a special [sprIcon,3]Volley

bilby1.desc: Their busy mind is only at rest while they dig. They'll hyperfocus for days on a single burrow.
bilby1.name: Bildit

recruit.description: 2+ times, use a special [sprIcon,3]Volley

bilby2.desc: Following fires, rockslides, or other natural disasters, Handicoots often appear and help out.
bilby2.name: Handicoot

recruit.description: 3+ times, use a special [sprIcon,3]Volley

cassowary.desc: They have an intense daily training regimen. If they miss it for some reason, they aren't able to sleep at night.
cassowary.name: Kasaleet

recruit.description: Hit this Beastie with an attack that has 100 POW or more

cassowary1.desc: Anytime they encounter something new, they kick it. Kicking is their way of understanding the world.
cassowary1.name: Kichik

recruit.description: Hit this Beastie with an attack that has 60 POW or more

cassowary2.desc: Despite their powerful legs they insist on using their head for everything. As a result they have frequent headaches and are usually grumpy.
cassowary2.name: Ostrisigh

recruit.description: Hit this Beastie with an attack that has 80 POW or more

cheerleader.desc: Its fluff is made of incredibly thin strands of wax, bundled like wool. If a Cherrily makes you a pom, it considers you a treasured friend.

value.description: [sprBoost,1]BOOST a Cherrily's [sprIcon,0]POW to +6 or more while their field has RHYTHM

cheerleader.name: Cherrily

recruit.description: Gain 5+ [sprBoost,2]BOOSTS on one Beastie

cheerleader1.desc: It's extremely light and drifts with air currents. Groups of Merrifly will hold onto each other so as not to drift apart.
cheerleader1.name: Merrifly

recruit.description: Gain 4+ [sprBoost,2]BOOSTS on one Beastie

cheerleadermon.desc: Celia's Notes: Most of what you see is a display. The real body is hidden inside... Perhaps it's a defensive adaptation?
cheerleadermon.name: Mascurry

recruit.description: Gain 5+ [sprBoost,2]BOOSTS on one Beastie

clam.desc: Their dense internal structure is 99% made up of muscle. They can easily lift 20x their own body weight.
clam.name: Musselbound

recruit.description: Receive 3+ [sprIcon,0]BODY attacks

clown.desc: They have an incredible sense of balance and can juggle a ball while standing at any angle on any surface.
clown.name: Goofsder

recruit.description: Launch an attack while your Beasties share the left or right Lane

clown1.desc: They relentlessly practice acrobatic tricks while dangling from treetops and frequently fall. Luckily they can simply curl up and bounce to safety.
clown1.name: Webbounce

recruit.description: Launch an attack while your Beasties share the left or right Lane

crab.desc: A leg from their molted shell is kept as a cane. They perform intricate dances in unison to bond and to attract mates.
crab.name: Crabaret

recruit.description: Win without volleying, using at least 2 attacks

croc.desc: An ambush predator. They lie perfectly still blending in with foliage and then snap with jaws that could shred metal.
croc.name: Crawlurk

recruit.description: Deal 60+ damage with a SERVE

daredevil.desc: Their top speed is over 100kmph. They race across the desert, then curl up into balls and cool off in any shadow they can find.
daredevil.name: Daredillo

recruit.description: 2+ times, MOVE or SHIFT a Beastie to receive an attack

daredevil1.desc: Hyper-competitive, they begin playing Beastieball at a much earlier age than other juvenile Beasties. They will race against anything that moves near them, including trains.
daredevil1.name: Radillo

recruit.description: MOVE or SHIFT a Beastie before they receive an attack

disruptor.desc: They'll chase away perceived invaders with cacophonous sound. Their drum and screeching can be heard from 3 kilometers away.
disruptor.name: Noizard

recruit.description: Make any Beastie feel [sprStatus,3]NOISY or [sprStatus,8]JAZZED

dog.desc: They easily scale cliffsides with huge leaps. They're guardians who make sure small Beasties don't go astray in the mountains.
dog.name: Fetcham

recruit.description: Make this Beastie receive 3+ attacks

dog1.desc: They are obsessed with chasing balls. It's said that they see the moon itself as a giant Beastieball which they yearn to chase.
dog1.name: Woollie

recruit.description: Make this Beastie receive 3+ attacks

dragonfly.desc: Their bodies are made from hard translucent chitin. Depending on the arrangement of their cells, they refract light differently and can appear as vastly different colors.
dragonfly.name: Kaleidarn

recruit.description: Deal 100+ damage with an attack

football.desc: Compressed air in their joints gives them explosive power. They can aim a Beastieball at targets 300m away.
football.name: Beetlback

recruit.description: Volley the ball 4+ times

football1.desc: They run head-first, full speed into anything they encounter. Their exoskeleton gradually hardens from repeated impacts.
football1.name: Scrubbub

recruit.description: Volley the ball 3+ times

football2.desc: Their armor is as tough as steel. They settle their frequent territorial disputes with contests of strength.
football2.name: Grubiron

recruit.description: Volley the ball 3+ times

fox.desc: Using harvested venomous cells, they deliver a painful sting at the slightest touch. Their venom is known to cause vivid hallucination.
fox.name: Vultoxin

recruit.description: Land 3+ [sprIcon,2] attacks on this Beastie

fox1.desc: Their parents swam far upriver to deposit Seakit eggs in the forest. They harvest stinging cells from Petula to mature.
fox1.name: Seakit

recruit.description: Land 2+ [sprIcon,2] attacks on this Beastie

frog.desc: Seldom seen, but commonly known for their haunting singing heard across lakes and rivers. In folklore their voice guides spirits to the afterlife.
frog.name: Hopra

recruit.description: Boost any [sprIcon,0][sprIcon,1][sprIcon,2]POW [sprBoost,0][sprBoost,0][sprBoost,0][sprBoost,0][sprBoost,0] or more on a Beastie

frog1.desc: They crave attention. They can hardly spend time with their own kind because they compete for an audience.
frog1.name: Axolati

recruit.description: Boost any [sprIcon,0][sprIcon,1][sprIcon,2]POW [sprBoost,0][sprBoost,0][sprBoost,0] or more on a Beastie

frog2.desc: They are constantly, restlessly performing. If anyone around them isn't happy it only encourages them further.
frog2.name: Hopsong

recruit.description: Boost any [sprIcon,0][sprIcon,1][sprIcon,2]POW [sprBoost,0][sprBoost,0][sprBoost,0][sprBoost,0] or more on a Beastie

ghost.desc: They seem to enjoy performing for other Beasties. They conjure the most impressive displays when seducing a mate.
ghost.name: Mistic

recruit.description: Land a [sprIcon,0] attack on this Beastie

ghost1.desc: They deftly manipulate gas to create a threat display. They are known for their distinctive sour smell when they're nearby.
ghost1.name: Gastic

recruit.description: Land a [sprIcon,0] attack on this Beastie

ghost2.desc: They are able to control the density of their gas to manipulate solid matter. The gas is mostly harmless to inhale.
ghost2.name: Wisper

recruit.description: Land a [sprIcon,0] attack on this Beastie

gremlin.desc: A notorious urban pest, known for opportunistically stealing from humans. They are considered one of the smartest Beasties.
gremlin.name: Gremlur

recruit.description: Make any Beastie feel [sprStatus,0]NERVOUS, [sprStatus,12]STRESSED, or [sprStatus,2]SHOOK

horseshoe.desc: An ancient Beastie that has hardly changed in 400 million years. Their ability to play Beastieball both on land and deep undersea has allowed them to thrive through climate shifts.
horseshoe.name: Xiphosaur

recruit.description: Deal 99 damage with an attack

ibis.desc: They nest in bins and hoard garbage. They mimic one anothers' adornments in pursuit of glamor, creating trends of trash fashion.
ibis.name: Bindiva

recruit.description: Launch an attack while your Beasties are both at the net

jellyfish.desc: Their hive mind can be slow to make decisions, leaving them inert for long periods. Inert Orgella are frequently mistaken for fruit.
jellyfish.name: Orgella

recruit.description: Reduce this Beastie's STAMINA to 0

jellyfish1.desc: They're extraordinarily simple and underdeveloped. They swim with single-minded desire to join with other Petula.
jellyfish1.name: Petula

recruit.description: 2+ times, give any Beastie a FEELING

jellyfish2.desc: A collection of Petula working together as one. Each takes on a different function as part of the collective.
jellyfish2.name: Flowish

recruit.description: Reduce this Beastie's STAMINA to 0

kangaroo.desc: Even at their calmest, they communicate in piercing shrieks. The loudest Garood tends to be the leader of the flock.
kangaroo.name: Garood

recruit.description: Use 3+ [sprIcon,4]SUPPORT plays

kangaroo1.desc: They are skilled at mimicry and can even learn human words. They especially favor sounds which get a rise out of others.
kangaroo1.name: Rookee

recruit.description: Use 2+ [sprIcon,4]SUPPORT plays

kettle.desc: Their body is dense with fatty tissue storage, which constantly metabolizes into heat and steam. They migrate from arctic climates to raise Druppa near hot springs.
kettle.name: Scauldra

recruit.description: 2+ times, make any Beastie feel [sprStatus,6]SWEATY, [sprStatus,10]TIRED, [sprStatus,12]STRESSED or [sprStatus,11]TENDER

kettle1.desc: Despite their intensely high body temperature, they constantly seek heat sources as though they were cold. Take care when handling them directly.
kettle1.name: Druppa

recruit.description: Make any Beastie feel [sprStatus,6]SWEATY, [sprStatus,10]TIRED, [sprStatus,12]STRESSED or [sprStatus,11]TENDER

lyrebird.desc: They protect forests from fire by raking soil to encourage plant decomposition. When fires do break out, they attentively manage them.
lyrebird.name: Zefyre

recruit.description: Make 4+ [sprIcon,8]MOVE actions

lyrebird1.desc: They are constantly in motion. Their colorful plumage is a point of pride and they sometimes accessorize it with flower petals.
lyrebird1.name: Sefren

recruit.description: Make 3+ [sprIcon,8]MOVE actions

magpie.desc: They receive gifts from one another on their pikes. A heavily laden Magpike is a popular one.

value.description: A Magpike must reduce their own STAMINA to 0 while their [sprIcon,0]POW is [sprBoost,1]BOOSTed [sprBoost,0][sprBoost,0][sprBoost,0] or more

magpie.name: Magpike

recruit.description: Use a COMBO play

magpie1.desc: They identify themselves through song. Tight cliques will often form around a common melody.
magpie1.name: Punkchirp

recruit.description: Use a COMBO play

magpiemon.desc: Celia's Notes: Their scream is tremendous! In prehistoric times it might have been for warning, or mating, or both.
magpiemon.name: Maraptor

recruit.description: Hit this Beastie with an attack that has less than 40 POW

mantis.desc: They'll stand perfectly still in plain sight, mimicking a tree. When prey least suspects it, they strike with blinding speed.
mantis.name: Armantis

recruit.description: Take less than 10 damage from an attack

millipede.desc: They swing their armored head at high velocities to break through rock. The tunnels they create often become homes for other cave-dwellers.
millipede.name: Demolipede

recruit.description: 2+ times, TAG IN a Beastie to receive an attack

millipede1.desc: They are diligent excavators. They are often at work clearing away debris left over from Demolipede activity.
millipede1.name: Milimine

recruit.description: TAG IN a Beastie to receive an attack

monkey.desc: They exhibit complex social behavior and mediate disputes between other Beasties. Brighter-chested Grazadas tend to be leaders.
monkey.name: Grazada

recruit.description: Reduce this Beastie's STAMINA to 0, not via ball attack

moth.desc: They can manipulate emotions with potent pheromones. Anyone who touches their mask, made from all the material they collected as a pupa, will face their wrath.
moth.name: Plumask

recruit.description: [sprBoost,1]BOOST any stat to +4 or more

moth1.desc: Their spines naturally collect plant detritus as they move about, building up their protective coat.
moth1.name: Collarva

recruit.description: [sprBoost,1]BOOST any stat [sprBoost,0][sprBoost,0] or more

moth2.desc: This Beastie hides in its cocoon and pilots a constructed decoy. They build masks and experiment with personas they might grow into.
moth2.name: Wormask

recruit.description: [sprBoost,1]BOOST any stat [sprBoost,0][sprBoost,0][sprBoost,0] or more

mudskipper.desc: They can keep cool and moist in any environment. They're known for their relaxed demeanor, but they'll dance provocatively for any romantic interest.
mudskipper.name: Mudslee

recruit.description: Make any Beastie feel [sprStatus,1]ANGRY or [sprStatus,6]SWEATY

nerd.desc: They're attracted to the hum of computers. It's every network engineer's nightmare to flick the lights on in the server room, only to find a Debugly.
nerd.name: Debugly

recruit.description: Have this Beastie survive an attack with 75 POW or more

nerd1.desc: They make their home in office desks where they can readily access their favorite food: paper. Math homework is especially enticing for them.
nerd1.name: Calcroach

recruit.description: Have this Beastie survive an attack with 50 POW or more

okapi.desc: The existence of this Beastie was long disputed. They only become fully visible to those they trust deeply.
okapi.name: Skulkapi

recruit.description: Activate a Skulkapi's trait with this Beastie on the field

olm.desc: They have incredible regenerative abilities. Many folk tales about sea monsters were most likely inspired by Hydrolm.
olm.name: Hydrolm

recruit.description: Restore 30+ STAMINA at one time on a Beastie

olm1.desc: Their heart beats only twice per minute. Their "eyes" are fake; in fact, they are blind. They live in dark, wet places and are active only when playing Beastieball.
olm1.name: Proteos

recruit.description: Restore 15+ STAMINA at one time on a Beastie

opossum.desc: Although infamous for picking fights, they keep troublesome Beasties like Gremlur in check. If they lose at sports they will avoid shame by pretending they've died.
opossum.name: Opposur

recruit.description: Deal 50+ damage to this Beastie without WIPING them out

platypus.desc: Celia's Notes: Their spines somehow store electricity. It's conducted through their teeth when they bite into something.
platypus.name: Pladion

recruit.description: Boost [sprIcon,2]DEF [sprBoost,0][sprBoost,0][sprBoost,0] or more on a Beastie

platypus1.desc: They use their bill to detect electrical fields. They heavily rely on this sense while the rest of their body develops.
platypus1.name: Platenna

recruit.description: Boost [sprIcon,2]DEF [sprBoost,0][sprBoost,0] or more on a Beastie

platypus2.desc: They have honed their electroreceptive sensitivity, allowing them to foresee the movements of other Beasties.

value.description: A Platypulse must have all [sprIcon,0][sprIcon,1][sprIcon,2]DEFs [sprBoost,1]BOOSTED +5 or more and receive 3+ attacks

platypus2.name: Platypulse

recruit.description: Boost [sprIcon,2]DEF [sprBoost,0][sprBoost,0][sprBoost,0] or more on a Beastie

possum.desc: They're fearless solo foragers who will challenge anyone. They don't seem to remember they were once tiny Shooga.
possum.name: Supilero

recruit.description: Land a no-touch point

possum1.desc: Their semitransparent ears shield their eyes from wind as they glide. They feel safest in large groups, especially with watchful Sefren.
possum1.name: Shooga

recruit.description: Land a no-touch point

possum2.desc: They can hear the footsteps of distant predators. They'll hide for as long as it takes for danger to pass.
possum2.name: Supassum

recruit.description: Land a no-touch point

psychic.desc: Scientists still don't understand how this Beastie adapted psychokinetic abilities. Psylusc are known to influence the tides to protect their precious coral reefs.
psychic.name: Psylusc

recruit.description: Land 2+ [sprIcon,2]MIND attacks on this Beastie

rainbow.desc: Each one has a unique ink color. They tend to form colonies of similar color and mark their territory with vivid graffiti.

value.description: A Squimage must change its Trait while its [sprIcon,0][sprIcon,1][sprIcon,2]DEFs are BOOSTed [sprBoost,0][sprBoost,0][sprBoost,0] or more

rainbow.name: Squimage

recruit.description: Land a [sprIcon,0] attack, a [sprIcon,1] attack and a [sprIcon,2] attack

rainbowmon.desc: Celia's Notes: Their bioluminescent body likely helps them navigate the deep sea and hypnotize prey. However, at lower pressures, they liquify.
rainbowmon.name: Diabloceras

recruit.description: Land 3+ [sprIcon,0] attacks

rat.desc: They are often found in dumpsters. When they outgrow their can, Trats will gather with many others to exchange for larger cans.
rat.name: Trat

recruit.description: Use 2+ [sprIcon,5]DEFENSE plays

rocklizard.desc: Their tail carries most of their weight. They bludgeon would-be predators into a stupor before making their escape.
rocklizard.name: Boldlur

recruit.description: Boost [sprIcon,0]DEF [sprBoost,0][sprBoost,0][sprBoost,0][sprBoost,0] or more on a Beastie

rocklizard1.desc: They enjoy basking in the sun, but this leaves them vulnerable. They stick out their tongue to intimidate predators.
rocklizard1.name: Skibble

recruit.description: Boost [sprIcon,0]DEF [sprBoost,0][sprBoost,0] or more on a Beastie

rocklizard2.desc: Their decoy tail draws predators' attention away from their head. In a pinch, they'll drop their tail and quickly grow a new one.
rocklizard2.name: Skorock

recruit.description: Boost [sprIcon,0]DEF [sprBoost,0][sprBoost,0][sprBoost,0] or more on a Beastie

seabird.desc: Known to travel vast distances and through any weather, they can stay airborne for a week without rest and then float on the water's surface.
seabird.name: Skiffrig

recruit.description: 2+ times, attack with the Beastie who last received the ball

seabird1.desc: Juveniles will float on the ocean with their mouth open skyward awaiting food from their parents. Their brightly-colored neck pouch makes them visible from afar.
seabird1.name: Gullit

recruit.description: 2+ times, attack with the Beastie who last received the ball

seal.desc: They comb their hair with a special wax produced in their flippers. This keeps them incredibly smooth and able to glide over any surface.
seal.name: Broslidon

recruit.description: 2+ times, give this Beastie an Easy Receive

seal1.desc: Their incredibly dense hair keeps them well insulated even in cold ocean waters. Their actual body is quite small.
seal1.name: Leobro

recruit.description: Give this Beastie an Easy Receive

serval.desc: They leap high enough to snatch birds straight out of the sky. They'll leave claw marks on high places as a form of competition.
serval.name: Servace

recruit.description: Attack 3+ times from the front lane

serval1.desc: When on the hunt, they'll often allow prey to escape so that they can continue the chase and practice their pounce more.
serval1.name: Servitt

recruit.description: Attack 2+ times from the front lane

shark.desc: They can swing their whip-like tail incredibly fast. Underwater, it creates shockwaves that stuns prey senseless.
shark.name: Riplash

recruit.description: Take 50+ damage from an attack from this Beastie

shark1.desc: Their tail communicates everything. Rather than fight, Waglash compete by making the biggest splashes they can with their tail.
shark1.name: Waglash

recruit.description: Take 30+ damage from an attack from this Beastie

shroom1.desc: Its body is covered in microscopic fungal feelers, making it feel sticky. They tend to all varieties of plant life.
shroom1.name: Sprecko

recruit.description: Create any type of field effect

shroom_b.desc: The vibration of their belly drum promotes the growth of plants. Their habitats are always lush and overgrown.

value.description: A Bongus, Surgus or Illugus must commune with 3 mushroom colonies

shroom_b.name: Bongus

recruit.description: Create a RHYTHM field effect

shroom_m.desc: Though eerily quiet, they are constantly sending and receiving signals with nearby mycelia. As a result they have uncanny environmental awareness.

value.description: A Bongus, Surgus or Illugus must commune with 3 mushroom colonies

shroom_m.name: Illugus

recruit.description: Create a TRAP field effect

shroom_s.desc: This Beastie can lie in serenity for days, then suddenly fly into action. They are deeply attuned to the feelings of other Beasties.

value.description: A Bongus, Surgus or Illugus must commune with 3 mushroom colonies

shroom_s.name: Surgus

recruit.description: Create a RALLY field effect

shroommon.desc: Celia's Notes: Their growths are proto-Beastieballs. This might be the missing link between fungi and Beastie!
shroommon.name: Shloom

shy.desc: Chloroplasts from the plants they eat are absorbed and stored in their tails. This provides them camouflage as well as photosynthetic energy.
shy.name: Wottle

recruit.description: Boost [sprIcon,1]DEF [sprBoost,0][sprBoost,0][sprBoost,0] or more on a Beastie

snake.desc: They remove lightbulbs and take their place, feeding on the power supply. The bioluminescent fibres in their head glow brighter when they're well fed.
snake.name: Beelb

recruit.description: Let this Beastie boost [sprIcon,0]POW to [sprBoost,0][sprBoost,0][sprBoost,0] or more

snowspirit.desc: Their smaller wings help them conserve heat but became useless for flying. They're carnivores, and in extreme cases, will devour other Beasties.
snowspirit.name: Lunaptra

recruit.description: Land 3+ [sprIcon,0] attacks

spirit.desc: A superpollinator often found in lush flower fields. They will viciously hunt down any creature which endangers their flowers.
spirit.name: Heliath

recruit.description: Land 3+ [sprIcon,1] attacks

spirit1.desc: They fly tirelessly through any condition to find flowers to feed on. Seeing one is considered a lucky charm.
spirit1.name: Humflit

recruit.description: Land a [sprIcon,0] attack and a [sprIcon,1] attack

swift.desc: The fastest known flier of all. They use echolocation to rapidly navigate narrow cave systems.
swift.name: Blitzwift

recruit.description: SHIFT a Beastie 2+ times

tricky.desc: This pair is inseparable. Despite their highly developed sociability, they often remain solitary, perfectly satisfied with their own company.
tricky.name: Varkabond

recruit.description: WIPE OUT a Beastie with a SIDEWAYS attack

tricky1.desc: Their life cycle begins in caves, but they journey to the forest in adulthood. Each one selects a companion rock who they talk to as though it were alive.
tricky1.name: Troglum

recruit.description: WIPE OUT a Beastie with a SIDEWAYS attack

turtle.desc: Their large shells become mini-ecosystems supporting barnacles and sponges. Crews of Turogue will make their home there too.
turtle.name: Tortanchor

recruit.description: 4+ times, use a play this Beastie knows

turtle1.desc: A group of Turogue is called a crew. When they're together they will turn anything into a competition.
turtle1.name: Turogue

recruit.description: 2+ times, use a play this Beastie knows

turtle2.desc: They aren't great swimmers, but their bouyant shell keeps them afloat when they're in the water.
turtle2.name: Turtaneer

recruit.description: 3+ times, use a play this Beastie knows

wizard.desc: Their feathers are exceptionally tough and lustrous. When they're loosed by ball impacts it makes Conjarr appear to sparkle.
wizard.name: Conjarr

recruit.description: Make this Beastie feel [sprStatus,9]BLOCKED

yeti.desc: Once thought to be solitary creatures. It was discovered they communicate with one another across mountain peaks with reflected light from their horn ice.
yeti.name: Yamyth

recruit.description: Give this Beastie any [sprBoost,3]BOOST
